data.title: The Best Movies With Name in the Title
data.meta_description: The Best Movies With Name in the Title, as voted on by fans. Current Top 3: My Name Is Nobody, The Name of the Rose, Your Name
data.text:
How many movies with name in the title can you name? This list ranks the best movies with name in the name, whether they're documentaries, dramas, horror movies, or any other genre of film. Do you have a favorite movie with name in the title? Categorizing movies by words in their titles is kind of uncommon, but that's a big part of why this list is so fun to scroll through. There's probably one movie with name in the title you think of right away, but you might be shocked to see how many others exist as well.

Notable films with name in the title include In the Name of the Father, The Name of the Rose, and In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale, although there are many more examples on this list. This poll is interactive, meaning you can vote the name movies up or down depending on how much you like them.

Released : 1973

Directed by : Tonino Valerii

A whimsical take on the spaghetti western genre, this film follows an ambitious but bumbling gunslinger who desires to be a legend. The protagonist unexpectedly forms a bond with a retiring outlaw, blending comedy and action in an unusual yet captivating manner.

Released : 1986

Directed by : Jean-Jacques Annaud

Set in a medieval monastery, this enthralling mystery thriller is steeped in historical intrigue. With engaging performances from Sean Connery and Christian Slater, viewers are drawn into a complex web of murder, politics, and religious tensions.

Ry√ªnosuke Kamiki, Mone Kamishiraishi, Etsuko Ichihara

Released : 2016

Directed by : Makoto Shinkai

Stunning visuals and a heartwarming story form the backbone of this Japanese animated film. The plot revolves around two teenagers who swap bodies and forge a deep connection while trying to overcome the challenges posed by their strange predicament.

Released : 1998

Directed by : Ken Loach

A raw, emotional portrayal of addiction and redemption, this film is driven by Peter Mullan's powerhouse performance. The story follows a recovering alcoholic as he navigates both personal struggles and romance in his attempt to rebuild his life.

Released : 2010

Directed by : Karan Johar

A poignant and powerful tale about love, loss, and overcoming adversity, this Bollywood drama stars Shah Rukh Khan in an unforgettable performance. As an Indian Muslim man with Asperger's syndrome, he embarks on a cross-country journey to prove his loyalty to his adopted homeland.

Released : 2007

Directed by : Uwe Boll

A thrilling action-adventure film that's sure to delight fans of fantasy and medieval tales. As an unassuming farmer seeks revenge for his murdered family, he finds himself at the center of a battle for the kingdom's future.
